org.jetel.util.bytes

Class ByteBufferUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jetel.util.bytes.ByteBufferUtils

  • public final class ByteBufferUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides static methods for working with ByteBuffer in association with Channels
    Since:
    Oct 20, 2006

      Max size of integer encoded via encodeLength in bytes.

      • flush

        public static int flush(java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer,
        java.nio.channels.WritableByteChannel writer)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        This method flushes the buffer (data from the begging of buffer to position) to the Channel and prepares it for next reading
        Parameters:
        buffer -
        writer -
        Returns:
        The number of bytes written, possibly zero
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • reload

        public static int reload(java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer,
         java.nio.channels.ReadableByteChannel reader)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        This method reads new data to the buffer. The bytes between the buffer's current position and its limit are copied to the beginning of the buffer and new bytes are read after them. Upon return the buffer's position will be equal to p + n, where p is number of compacted bytes an n - number of read bytes; its limit will be set to capacity.
        Parameters:
        buffer -
        reader -
        Returns:
        The number of bytes read, possibly zero
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

           java.io.OutputStream out)

        This method rewrites bytes from input stream to output stream

        out -
        Throws:

      • rewrite

        public static void rewrite(java.io.InputStream in,
           java.io.OutputStream out,
           long bytes)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        This method rewrites maximum "bytes" bytes from input stream to output stream
        Parameters:
        in -
        out -
        bytes - number of bytes to rewrite
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • encodeLength

        public static final int encodeLength(CloverBuffer buffer,
               int length)
        Encodes length (int value) into set of bytes occupying least space
        Parameters:
        buffer - ByteBuffer to which encode length
        length - value which should be encoded
        Returns:
        number of bytes (in buffer) needed to encode the length
        Since:
        21.11.2006

      • encodeLength

        public static final int encodeLength(java.io.OutputStream stream,
               int length)
                              throws java.io.IOException
        Encodes length (positive int value) into set of bytes occupying least space. Bytes are written directly to provided stream.
        Parameters:
        stream -
        length -
        Returns:
        number of bytes needed to encode the length and written to the stream
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • decodeValue

                               java.nio.ByteOrder byteOrder)
        Decodes the value stored in the byte buffer using the specified byte order.
        Parameters:
        buffer - source buffer
        byteOrder -
        Returns:
        decoded value of the byte buffer

      • encodeValue

        public static int encodeValue(CloverBuffer buffer,
              long value,
              java.nio.ByteOrder byteOrder,
              int minLength)
        Convenience method, see encodeValue(CloverBuffer, BigInteger, ByteOrder, int).

      • encodeValue

        public static int encodeValue(CloverBuffer buffer,
              java.math.BigInteger value,
              java.nio.ByteOrder byteOrder,
              int minLength)
        Encodes the value into the byte buffer using the specified byte order. minLength can be used to specify padding, otherwise set it to 0. No check for maximum length is performed.
        Parameters:
        buffer - target buffer
        value - the value to convert to bytes
        byteOrder - ByteOrder.BIG_ENDIAN or ByteOrder.LITTLE_ENDIAN
        minLength - minimum length, used for padding
        Returns:
        number of bytes encoding the value

      • fill

        public static void fill(java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer,
        byte value,
        int count,
        boolean advance)
        Fills the ByteBuffer with defined value. Does not change buffer's current position.
        Parameters:
        buffer - buffer to be filled
        value - byte valued to be used
        count - how many bytes to be filled
        advance - whether buffer's current position should be moved

      • fill

        public static void fill(java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer,
        byte value,
        int count)

      • expandCharBuffer

        public static java.nio.CharBuffer expandCharBuffer(java.nio.CharBuffer oldBuffer,
                                   int requestedCapacity,
                                   int maximumCapacity)
        Creates deep copy of the given CharBuffer with at least requested capacity and at most maximum capacity. The resulted deep copy has same internal state (position, limit, mark) as the given buffer.
        Parameters:
        oldBuffer - copied buffer
        requestedCapacity - the resulted buffer has at least this capacity
        maximumCapacity - the resulted buffer has at most this capacity
        Returns:
        the deep copy of the given buffer with expanded capacity

      • fill

        public static void fill(java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer,
        byte value)
        Fills the ByteBuffer with defined value. Does not change buffer's current position.
        Parameters:
        buffer - buffer to be filled
        value - byte valued to be used

      • findNextRecord

        public static long findNextRecord(java.nio.channels.SeekableByteChannel channel,
                  java.nio.charset.Charset channelCharset,
                  java.lang.String[] delimiters)
                           throws java.io.IOException
        Find next delimiter in a seekable channel
        Parameters:
        channel - Input channel, current position may be changed after return from the method
        recordDelimiter - An array of delimiters
        Returns:
        position of the first character after first delimiter, returned position is relative to the original position in the channel
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
